subject: Music
title: Mozart: The Child Prodigy
description: A 60-second lesson on Mozart: The Child Prodigy.

hook.text: Mozart was composing at five, touring Europe at six, and writing symphonies at eight.

buildup.text: His father Leopold trained him relentlessly and exhibited him across royal courts.

discovery.text: He wrote 41 symphonies, 27 piano concertos, and over 20 operas in just 35 years of life.

twist.text: Despite his genius, he died in poverty ‚Äî buried in an unmarked common grave in Vienna.

climax.text: His music sounds effortlessly perfect ‚Äî hiding extraordinary complexity beneath elegance.

punchline.text: He made the impossible sound easy. That was his true genius.
